answers.answer: Tongue movements are controlled by the 12th cranial nerve (hypoglossal).  The functioning of this nerve is what the doctor is looking for when he asks you to "stick out your tongue".  Your condition suggests a palsy of the 12th cranial nerve, which can be caused by many things, from diabetes, to vitamin B-12 deficiency, to an aneurysm. This symptom, juxtaposed with migraine, would suggest an MRI would be appropriate.
